breakthroughPP.gui

Class GridPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • breakthroughPP.gui.GridPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Showable, Requestable, Setting, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GridPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Setting, Requestable, Showable, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the main panel for the game gui. It provides a grid of buttons with the according tokens on which the moves can be executed.

    Georg-August University Goettingen APP breakthroughPP SoSe 2016 Gr CodeSalat

    Author:
    Fabiola Buschendorf, Artur Zorn
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • GridPanel

        public GridPanel()
        Default constructor

      • GridPanel

        public GridPanel(Viewer viewer,
         int playerInt)
        A GridPanel with GameButtons is initialized. All buttons are placed. In the South Red tokens In the North Blue tokens
        Parameters:
        viewer - contains board information.
        playerInt - the player in this board.

        private void setWhosTurn(int colorofturn)

      • initButtons

        private void initButtons()
        Takes the current fields[][] values and draws a new button-grid by initialising the buttons. Adds the buttons to the panel, adds an ActionListener to each of them and sets Button names, needed by ActionListener.

      • getValidMoves

        public java.util.HashSet<Move> getValidMoves(int color)
                                      throws PresetException
        Calculate all valid moves for a player with a certain color by accessing the function Board.getValidMoves(int color).
        Parameters:
        color - color of the player whose valid moves are to be calculated (See @link{#Setting}
        Returns:
        a set containing all valid moves for the color.
        Throws:
        PresetException - if a Position in this function throws one

      • updateButtons

        public void updateButtons()
        The function updates the button size depending on the size of the frame

      • updateAllValidMoves

        protected void updateAllValidMoves()
        According to the playerInt, the type of the player specified by its color, the valid moves are updated

      • swapButtons

        private void swapButtons(GameButton start,
               GameButton end)
        Swaps buttons which were moved. This means that the colors are changed.
        Parameters:
        start - one button to be switched
        end - button the first one is switched with

      • setButtonToGray

        private void setButtonToGray(GameButton removebutton)
        set a Button from GUI. Button will be shown as Gray field with colorInt.GRAY.
        Parameters:
        removebutton - Button that should be removed from color

      • checkValidMove

        private boolean checkValidMove(GameButton start,
                     GameButton end)
        Checks if a move is within the set of moves which are valid
        Parameters:
        start - start Position of the move to be checked
        end - end Position of the move to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid, false if not

      • updateStatus

        protected void updateStatus()
        Checks if one player reached opponent's side or if one player is dead and then updates status

      • createMove

        private Move createMove(GameButton start,
              GameButton end)
        The function creates a Move from the GameButtons it receives.
        Parameters:
        start - GameButton representing the start position of the move
        end - GameButton representing the end position of the move
        Returns:
        Move produced for the start and end position

      • performeMoveOnPanel

        private void performeMoveOnPanel(GameButton start,
                       GameButton end)
        Performes the changes on the coloring of this panel necessary to alter the game state after receiving a move. It also sets the currentMove as this move.
        Parameters:
        start - button where the move starts
        end - button where the move ends

      • deliver

        public Move deliver()
        This function waits for the user to make a move. This move is returned to the instance calling this function as the next move one performes. The move can be null indicating the player's surrender
        Specified by:
        deliver in interface Requestable
        See Also:
        Requestable.deliver()

      • init

        public void init(Viewer newstorage,
        int newcolor)
          throws VisualisationException
        Initialisation of the gridpanel
        Specified by:
        init in interface Showable
        Parameters:
        newstorage - Class containing information about the board of the player (see Viewer)
        newcolor - color of the player
        Throws:
        VisualisationException - if the during initialisation an error occures which makes it impossible to show the game state
        See Also:
        Showable

      • update

        public void update()
            throws VisualisationException
        Update of the grid panel with the latest changes on the board
        Specified by:
        update in interface Showable
        Throws:
        VisualisationException - if an error appears preventing this function to show the current state
        See Also:
        Showable

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent action)
        Reaction on an user clicking on one of the buttons of the grid panel. To activate this method, the function deliver() needed to be called previously so that canIplay is set true. After acception a move by this function canIplay is set to false.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        action - the ActionEvent which is produced by clicking on a button
        See Also:
        ActionListener
